attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: I want Government to create a law so Ayahuasca can be used legally in the UK
attributes.background:
It is a very helpful tool in allowing an individual who feels they want to explore themselves deeper and promotes healing; physically/ physchologically & spiritually. 
Ayahuasca promotes acceptance and resistance, giving power to the individual to decide, what is for them, their best way of being.
attributes.additional_details:
With facilitators supervising space, this provides a safe opportunity to experience the medicine

It is the use of Banisteriopsis caapi. 
A brew of B. caapi & P. viridis is the traditional South American brew. The caapi is particularly important as traditionally the caapi itself is considered to be “ayahuasca” while the DMT-containing plants are simply helpers.

Ayahuasca, also known as yage, is a blend of two plants - the ayahuasca vine and a shrub called chacruna (Psychotria viridis)

attributes.action: Government to urge all countries ban trophy hunting.
attributes.background: I believe the UK Government should put all the pressure it can to make Trophy Hunting illegal worldwide. If we do not do something magnificent creatures will be lost for future generations. I would also like to be illegal to kill a similar creature in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: Trophy hunters are killing 70,000 animals ever year.

attributes.action: Provide special constables with a right to time off work to undertake duties
attributes.background: There is no right to unpaid time off work to undertake duties as a special constable.  Other public duties benefit from this right such as magistrates and council members. Special constables patrol side by side with paid police officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 50(1) of the Employment Rights Act 1996 provides:

"An employer shall permit an employee of his who is a justice of the peace to take time off during the employee’s working hours for the purpose of performing any of the duties of his office."

The petitioner proposes a simple amendment to the Act:  after "justice of the peace" insert "or a special constable".  This would provide recognition to thousands of special constables in the country, providing them with the right to undertake their duties.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: Award ten bank holiday's to England/Wales.
attributes.background:
England/Wales get 8 bank holidays, Scotland get 9 and Northern Ireland get 10.

The government should take into consideration that we need more bank holidays in order to have more personal and family time as we have the right to a private and family life and more bank holidays will help with this!

attributes.action: Licence possession of all knives that have potential to harm.
attributes.background: Our licensing laws forbid guns in our drawers, so why can't our government push for a change? License the manufacturing and possession of potential weapons. Rounded edge knives only unless licensed.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for permitting assisted dying for terminally ill individuals.
attributes.background: The public opinion is in favour of allowing assisted dying for the terminally ill but the Parliament consistently opposes this.

attributes.action: Yarl's Wood should be closed down as unfit for purpose.
attributes.background: Hunger strikes, women put on planes in their nighties, children being reclassified as over 18.  This is a national shame.  Yarl's Wood has been an open sore for years now, the Sky News story,  'Immigration Centre Detainees 'treated like pigs'", 2/5/18 is one in a long line of stories
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/yarls-wood-inside-experience-hunger-strike-immigration-detention-scandal-a8230056.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/children-fleeing-warzones-being-locked-up-at-yarls-wood-detention-centre-investigation-finds-10337409.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/windrush-generation-scandal-shappi-khorsandi-i-applaud-david-lammy-a8313906.html

attributes.action: Stop all councils from using enforcement agencies, bailiffs and threats of court
attributes.background: Council tax and poverty don't mix! If you are unable to pay on time you will be put into debt by your council. Theres no communication with customers they pass your bill to enforcement agencies with added fees,threats of ballifs,court and jail. If you believe this shouldn't be happening please sign.

attributes.action: Ensure the Windrush generation can exercise their right to vote.
attributes.background: People affected by the Windrush debacle have had every right that UK citizens take for granted, including the right to vote. Now that the citizenship issue is being resolved, it is only right and proper to ensure they can exercise their right to vote.

attributes.action: Non transitioned transgender* members of military serve as identified gender
attributes.background: Currently, transgender people must have completed transition to be treated as the gender they identify with. It takes years and years to fully transition, meaning some people may have their dreams of joining the British military destroyed. We should allow people to serve as who they are.
attributes.additional_details: Our country prides itself on tolerance and acceptance of all people, regardless of their sex, race, sexual orientation, religion, but why in the British military do we not accept them for their gender (change). Being treated as someone who you are not can make you feel extremely uncomfortable, dysphoric and could even lead to mental health issues. The UK army has recently had a "This is belonging" campaign, but why don't trans* people belong in their identified gender? Please change this

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for apprentices to at least £6
attributes.background: Currently the minimum wage for apprentices is £3.70. This means that if an apprentice works 40 hours per week, they will only receive £7,696 a year. This is not enough money to live off and does not provide a big enough incentive for school levers to start work and have a successful career.

attributes.action: Allow police to confiscate mobile phones when drivers are caught using them.
attributes.background: Fining drivers for mobile phone use appears to be of little deterrent on its own. A fine along with points on the license and immediate confiscation could possibly have more impact. The inconvenience and cost of losing all personal contacts and data would, for some people, be immeasurable.
attributes.additional_details: Lincolnshire recently had a blitz on catching drivers using mobile phones, as far as I can see that made absolutely no difference. I see the same people day in day out driving while using hand held mobile phones, that includes tractor drivers.

attributes.action: Hold a snap election in response to Theresa May's poor leadership over Syria.
attributes.background: Theresa May's decision to approve air strikes in Syria without consulting the British parliament should not go unchallenged. Her lack of consideration has called the safety of this country into question and put innocent lives of the Syrian people in danger.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: Make a nationwide policy to allow NHS Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes at all times. This would recognise that Ambulance journeys are important.  Ambulances sitting in queues of traffic while Bus Lanes are free doesn't make much sense. This would save the NHS money.
attributes.additional_details: NHS ambulances are a form of public transport & should have the same right to use Bus Lanes as Buses & Taxis.

attributes.action: Change when employers can dismiss employees without cause back to one year.
attributes.background: The qualifying period for unfair dismissal increased from one to two years in April of 2012. This made it easy for a company to dismiss someone after less than two years' employment. You could work for a company for nearly two years and be dismissed for no apparent reason.
attributes.additional_details: You have no options once this happens as the company is not obligated to reinstate you, offer another position, and neither are you entitled to compensation outside their discretion which is quite often unsatisfactory. With the current system, good employees are left with no security.

attributes.action: Ban gas stunning of animals
attributes.background: Gas stunning is a cruel method of killing animals. A video on YouTube made me aware of this horrid way animals are killed everyday. It should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Debate the United Kingdom's recognition of Kosovo as an Independent Country.
attributes.background: I believe Kosovo was wrongly recognised as an independent country by the United Kingdom. The bombing campaign conducted by NATO in 1999 and Kosovo's separation in 2008, were unjust acts upon Serbia. This should be debated in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom wrongly recognised Kosovo's unilateral declaration of independence a day after it was declared on the 17th of February 2008. The unjust settlement was introduced without the agreement of both parties and a binding Security Council resolution. Serbia’s sovereignty was thus undermined and disrespected in the process. Therefore, the declaration of independence by Kosovo can be argued to be an unlawful secession and needs to be debated in parliament once more.

attributes.action: Amend Microchip Regulations to require chip alerts for stolen dogs when scanned
attributes.background:
There is no method to raise an alert (where the dog is stolen) when a dog is scanned by a vet or authorised person.
When the data operators records show the dog as stolen, an alert should be made to the individual operating the microchip scanner to alert them to such. Confiscation laws introduced.
attributes.additional_details:
When a dog is scanned (i.e. by a veterinary practice) the only information being provided through the scanner is the microchip number. If the information included alert data which was recorded by the data operator, provided by the true keeper, this could help with the recovery of stolen dogs.
Police / RSPCA officers etc should be given scanners to support this and enable them to scan when they identify potentially vulnerable dogs.

attributes.action: Make overtime tax free
attributes.background: We pay tax on our standard hours so we should get our overtime tax free

attributes.action: Make sensory rooms compulsory in schools and provide separate funding for it.
attributes.background: CAMHS is in a serious and worsening crisis and it is failing our children.   The first step to helping our children would be to equip our schools with sensory rooms.  This will be the foundation block for children with specialist learning needs, including autism and learning disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
Sensory rooms in schools will benefit our children hugely.  Please give your full support
https://www.experia-innovations.co.uk/blog/the-benefits-of-a-sensory-room/   
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/nhs-mental-health-services-children-turn-away-day-vulnerable-nspcc-study-a8047401.html
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/24/mental-health-children-camhs-jeremy-hunt-nhs-tragedies-funding-cuts
What is a sensory room
https://www.green-modular.com/blog/sensory-rooms-schools/

attributes.action: Utility companies to move elderly customers onto the cheapest available tariff.
attributes.background: Many elderly citizens are paying excessive amounts for gas, electricity and water. Make it law that utility companies must automatically place them on their cheapest available contracts at the time of renewal, not just place them on a standard expensive tariff.
attributes.additional_details: Utility markets are a competitive marketplace, and rightly so. Contract renewals are generally based around internet "Compare" websites that many elderly do not understand how to use. Electric and Gas suppliers are exploiting this fact by not moving them onto the best contract at renewal time. This is wrong and should be legislated against.

attributes.action: Create a new Ministerial Department called the Department For a Fair Society.
attributes.background:
New technologies could benefit everyone but instead, they are often exploited for maximum corporate profit 
The DFFS should: 
a) Find and support technologies that can have a revolutionary positive impact on society
b) Champion them to other government departments, the press and business groups
attributes.additional_details:
Technology already exists that can break the vicious circle of poverty, give fair access to top quality education and healthcare, and end the exploitation of vulnerable people by unscrupulous business. Instead of trying to fix our broken economy, these technologies could be harnessed to create a new, ethical model that will not favour the rich over the poor or any other group over another.
The DFFS would lead the country, and the rest of the world, to a fairer, more inclusive model for society.

attributes.action: Make health and nutrition a compulsory subject at Key Stage 2 and 3 level.
attributes.background: Childhood obesity is at its highest level ever in the UK and this is mainly due to a combination of lack of education in the majority of both adults and children, and misinformation spread by companies in order to sell products. By incorporating these subject in to KS2 and 3 it is providing the next
attributes.additional_details: Generation with the ability to make correctly informed choices about the foods they choose to consume.

attributes.action: Ban plastic carrier bags completely, this is to include ALL retailers.
attributes.background:
As we all know plastic is doing really bad things for our environment but yet the vast majority of us still use plastic bags daily when we buy groceries, cloths etc.

This should not be an option, there are alternatives, people just need to be prepared and carry an eco friendly bag, backpack etc.

attributes.action: Raise Firefighters' wages to a reasonable living wage (+ all emergency services)
attributes.background: The fire fighters are real life heroes risking their own life and limb, running into danger, for the sake of others and their property. Their wages, along with ALL other emergency service workers, have been frozen and capped instead of being given the recognition they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement of a firefighter: “Personally I go to work to earn money to provide for my family and myself.  In my mind all public services work extremely hard (Police, Fire, Ambulance or our nurses and doctors).  Our pay was frozen, then capped at 1% whilst inflation has risen at about 3%, our pension contributions have risen and the NI contributions we pay so, in effect, our wages have dropped.” 

ALL emergency services deserve a decent living wage and appropriate funding for volunteer agencies.

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Make dementia training mandatory within the NHS and hospitals.
attributes.background: Help me change how people living with dementia can have a better quality of care when visiting the hospital and being treated by staff with very little or no experience and  knowledge of the disease and also help the staff to better their knowledge and understanding of dementia.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly lady living with dementia in a care home setting had a fall as was taken to A & E due to NHS staff ( GP's, OT's, Radiographers and nurses ) lack of understanding and knowledge of dementia. She was sedated unnecessarily as they said she was a risk to herself.

attributes.action: Establish quorum and meaningful majority criteria to validate future referenda.
attributes.background: Referendums are affecting the future of the UK. A 50.1% majority is slight and have left nearly half the electorate unsatisfied and discontented. Criteria such as the definition of a quorum would establish the initial validity of the referendum and more accurately reflect the will of the electorate.

attributes.action: Change Abortion law to a period of 12 weeks instead of 24 weeks.
attributes.background: The Irish are proposing to introduce legislation that will restrict Category C abortions to 12 weeks, whilst we continue to allow abortions up to 24 weeks - far beyond the time when a baby can survive outside the womb.  This needs changed.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017 there were 194,668 legal abortions carried out in England & Wales (ie just over 745 abortions per working day). Of these, 98% (185,448) were carried out under category C. Of these, 99.5% were reported as being performed because of a risk to the woman’s mental health. In 13 cases, an abortion was performed under category C because of complications of pregnancy. Source - Abortion Statistics, England and Wales: 2017, Department of Health & Social Care

attributes.action: Add metric km/h to speed signs under the imperial mph sign.
attributes.background: So as the Metric system is a lot easier to convert lengths through I think we should convert our measurements to km/h while keeping the mph sign for old road users. I think we should add the km/h sign under the mph road sign with a different coloured ring (green maybe) and km/h after it.
attributes.additional_details: This would make it easier to judge distance for younger people as younger people are being taught the metric system. As most cars have km/h along side mph this would mean it would have almost instant impact. Also it is great for tourists and european people that come from a totally metric county drive safer.

attributes.action: Increase the national living wage for all UK workers over 18 to £10.50 per hour.
attributes.background: We are privileged to live in a nation of immense wealth and opportunity but it is a sad and shameful fact that this wealth is not more evenly distributed amongst the working population.
attributes.additional_details: It must be recognised by all that the social, educational and economic opportunities that are available to citizens who are paid the current living wage/minimum wage are considerably less than those individuals who are fortunate enough to earn more. Any civilised society should strive to protect its citizens from exploitation and hardship by ensuring that the national living wage is fair and equal for all workers over the age of 18 irrespective of contract or skill.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: Year 10 & Year 11 students should focus on GCSEs and not have to do PE.
attributes.background: Secondary schools are forcing children in year 10 and year 11 to do PE (physical education), in other words sports. It should be a choice at GCSE to do PE. If the student has chosen Sports as a GCSE then they should do PE however if students did not pick Sports they should not be forced to do PE!
attributes.additional_details: Children should be focusing on their GCSEs and achieving high grades which will help further along in the education system, yet secondary schools are forcing children to do PE. Other subject will benefit the children more such as math. If the child is doing an average of 1 hour of PE a week, over the course of 39 weeks (average school year) it comes to a total of 78 hours from year 10-11. Definitely too many hours. This can be split up for other lessons which will help support the child better.

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Please remove age restriction in s3(5) of the British Nationality Act
attributes.background: Our son was denied an application to register as a British citizen because he had just turned 18, and informed by Home Office that his only path to citizenship was settlement / ILR (£2389 + Life in UK test £50) followed by naturalisation (£1330 + £20 for biometrics + £80 citizenship ceremony).
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the age restriction to register as a British citizen in section 3(5) birth abroad to parents who are British by descent but now domiciled in UK. Why does the entitlement under British Nationality law end upon reaching the age of 18? Article 8 / Human Rights Act 1998 and UN Declaration on Human Rights state inter alia "The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State."

attributes.action: Attach a mandatory Prison term to every charged Drink Driving case
attributes.background: Charged Drink Driving offences rarely carry any prison sentence and those with the money can easily afford any fine or ban. Adding a mandatory jail sentence should again make people think twice regardless of their status.
attributes.additional_details: Celebrities getting off with just fines and bans.

attributes.action: Create a Strategic Marine Resources Act
attributes.background:
Promote the protection of marine resources in the UK/British EEZ's
Safe guard UK fisheries within UK/British EEZ's post Brexit
Create and protect a sustainable asset for the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Under the UNCLOS each country has an EEZ and the protection of this natural resource is an important part of the members commitment.

The UK has no Strategic Fisheries Resources Act, and it does not have a Strategic Maritime Resources Act.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Ask the EU under Article 50(3) TFEU to extend the period before Brexit
attributes.background: Our future as a global trading nation hangs on our future relationship with the EU. That is far from certain and we need time to develop it. Once we leave the EU, our position will be weaker across the board. We should not  burn that bridge and move into the transition without more clarity.
attributes.additional_details: During the proposed transition, the UK will be a rule-taker, not a rule-maker. It will be able to sign – but not implement- trade agreements with partners outside the EU. There is no clear evidence of the availability, terms or value of such deals, and potential partners will wish to know the UK's future relationship with the EU before committing themselves. The Transition is too uncertain. We should not leave our existing terms with the EU before we are sure we are headed for a better future.

attributes.action: Don't allow councils to use private companies as Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.background: Councils are subcontracting their Enforcement Officers to private companies. It has been highlighted in the news and in a damning panorama report, private companies are out for profit and cannot make the right moral decisions. These powers need to remain with local council Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39882434

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Debate harmful effects of Balloon releasing.
attributes.background: Plastic in the seas is becoming more widely known. Releasing balloons is harmful to the environment, affecting land animals, sea mammals, creatures and is eventually ingested by fish. Research has found it is consumed by humans and pets via micro-plastics. Beaches are littered with enough rubbish.

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Make car insurance companies give their "BEST PRICE" when they send your renewal
attributes.background:
I received my car insurance renewal and it went up by £100, I shopped around and got a better price, I then called my current insurers and following some haggling they dropped the premiums by 23%.
I want the government to make insurers give their "BEST PRICE" on the renewal and not make you haggle

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USA’s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germany’s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VW’s top people.
